item.title: I need the ::unban command!
item.dc:creator: @Evanz Evanz
item.description:
@Evanz wrote:

[quote=“vic 08, post:8, topic:191817”][quote author=The roy6 link=topic=255489.msg2128241#msg2128241 date=1206235564]
Helpful yet lazy…
There is really no point to it because the file is right there plus if your banning. Need for unbanning is?
[/quote]

But you can be afk… and your admin could have been banned or mod banned accidently by like noclipping… and the co owner is there. whats he ganna doo… he can type ::unban * user * which is really helpful lol,

btw, werre like flaming this guys topic rofl :([br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 22, 2008, 02:29:27 PM[/size][hr]HERES THE UNBAN COMMAND

  • place this into your client underneath the ban command…
  • if it doesnt work, try adding more of { , } in the correct places…

[code] } else if (command.startsWith(“unban”) && playerRights >= 3) { // made by Musicmad
File file = new File("./data/bannedusers.txt");

        if (file.exists()) {
            String victim = command.substring(5);

            sendMessage("Player " + victim + " successfully unbanned"); // made by Musicmad	
            try {
                BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
                BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
                String unban = command.substring(6);
                String inFile;

                while ((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) {
                    if (inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unban)) {// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file.
                    } else {
                        out.write(inFile); // made by Musicmad
                    }

                }
            } catch (IOException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        } else {
            System.out.println("Error unbanning user"); 	
        }
    }[/code][/quote]

Well if the owner was allowing them to ::noclip…
then he would just set the noclip rights to 2…

obviously he wants them banned for trying to do it…

Read full topic

item.title: I need the ::unban command!
item.dc:creator: @vic_08 Vic_
item.description:
@vic_08 wrote:

[quote=“The roy6, post:7, topic:191817”]Helpful yet lazy…
There is really no point to it because the file is right there plus if your banning. Need for unbanning is?[/quote]

But you can be afk… and your admin could have been banned or mod banned accidently by like noclipping… and the co owner is there. whats he ganna doo… he can type ::unban * user * which is really helpful lol,

btw, werre like flaming this guys topic rofl :([br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 22, 2008, 02:29:27 PM[/size][hr]HERES THE UNBAN COMMAND

  • place this into your client underneath the ban command…
  • if it doesnt work, try adding more of { , } in the correct places…

[code] } else if (command.startsWith(“unban”) && playerRights >= 3) { // made by Musicmad
File file = new File("./data/bannedusers.txt");

        if (file.exists()) {
            String victim = command.substring(5);

            sendMessage("Player " + victim + " successfully unbanned"); // made by Musicmad	
            try {
                BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
                BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
                String unban = command.substring(6);
                String inFile;

                while ((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) {
                    if (inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unban)) {// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file.
                    } else {
                        out.write(inFile); // made by Musicmad
                    }

                }
            } catch (IOException e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        } else {
            System.out.println("Error unbanning user"); 	
        }
    }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: I need the ::unban command!
item.dc:creator: @vic_08 Vic_
item.description:
@vic_08 wrote:

[quote=“The roy6, post:5, topic:191817”]There is no real point to an unban command, if your asking then your own which means Data>bannedusers.txt>remove
Unban command won’t help unless your computer is that slow, In that case buy a new one?[/quote]

the ::unban ( name ) is alot easier lol i put it on my server, and it is very helpful…

Read full topic

item.title: I need the ::unban command!
item.dc:creator: @adog17x adog17x
item.description:
@adog17x wrote:

} else if ((playerRights > 0) && command.startsWith(“unban”)) {
try {
String name = command.substring(command.indexOf(" “)).trim();
sendMessage(“go to bans.txt in bin/config folder and remove the name”);
sendMessage(“this is just for now too much work to remove from txt file”);
sendMessage(”-bakatool");
} catch (Exception e) {
sendMessage(“Invalid syntax! Usage: ::unban NAME”);
e.printStackTrace();
}

Read full topic
